00:00:09:160000.Scene: Sheldon and Leonard’s apartment. Sheldon, Leonard, Howard and Raj are using laptops. All are wearing microphone headsets.
00:00:09:160000.Speaker: Howard
00:00:09:160000.Dialogue: Alright, just a few more feet. And... here we are, gentlemen, the Gates of Elzebob.

00:00:17:090000.Scene: Sheldon and Leonard’s apartment. Sheldon, Leonard, Howard and Raj are using laptops. All are wearing microphone headsets.
00:00:17:090000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:00:18:200000.Scene: Sheldon and Leonard’s apartment. Sheldon, Leonard, Howard and Raj are using laptops. All are wearing microphone headsets.
00:00:18:200000.Speaker: Leonard
00:00:18:200000.Dialogue: Don't panic. This is what the last 97 hours have been about.

00:00:22:040000.Scene: Sheldon and Leonard’s apartment. Sheldon, Leonard, Howard and Raj are using laptops. All are wearing microphone headsets.
00:00:22:040000.Speaker: Howard
00:00:22:040000.Dialogue: Stay frosty. There's a horde of armed goblins on the other side of that gate guarding the Sword of Asaroth.

00:00:27:230000.Scene: Sheldon and Leonard’s apartment. Sheldon, Leonard, Howard and Raj are using laptops. All are wearing microphone headsets.
00:00:27:230000.Speaker: Leonard
00:00:27:230000.Dialogue: Warriors, unsheathe your weapons. Magic wielders, raise your wands.

00:00:31:070000.Scene: Sheldon and Leonard’s apartment. Sheldon, Leonard, Howard and Raj are using laptops. All are wearing microphone headsets.
00:00:31:070000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:00:32:120000.Scene: Sheldon and Leonard’s apartment. Sheldon, Leonard, Howard and Raj are using laptops. All are wearing microphone headsets.
00:00:32:120000.Speaker: Howard

00:00:34:200000.Scene: Sheldon and Leonard’s apartment. Sheldon, Leonard, Howard and Raj are using laptops. All are wearing microphone headsets.
00:00:34:200000.Speaker: Raj
00:00:34:200000.Dialogue: Blowing the gates. Control, shift... B! Oh, my God, so many goblins!

00:00:46:070000.Scene: Sheldon and Leonard’s apartment. Sheldon, Leonard, Howard and Raj are using laptops. All are wearing microphone headsets.
00:00:46:070000.Speaker: Howard
00:00:46:070000.Dialogue: Don't just stand there, slash and move!

00:00:48:060000.Scene: Sheldon and Leonard’s apartment. Sheldon, Leonard, Howard and Raj are using laptops. All are wearing microphone headsets.
00:00:48:060000.Speaker: Leonard

00:00:49:100000.Scene: Sheldon and Leonard’s apartment. Sheldon, Leonard, Howard and Raj are using laptops. All are wearing microphone headsets.
00:00:49:100000.Speaker: Howard
00:00:49:100000.Dialogue: Leonard, you got one on your tail.

00:00:51:040000.Scene: Sheldon and Leonard’s apartment. Sheldon, Leonard, Howard and Raj are using laptops. All are wearing microphone headsets.
00:00:51:040000.Speaker: Leonard
00:00:51:040000.Dialogue: My tail's prehensile-- I'll swat him off.

00:00:53:090000.Scene: Sheldon and Leonard’s apartment. Sheldon, Leonard, Howard and Raj are using laptops. All are wearing microphone headsets.
00:00:53:090000.Speaker: Raj
00:00:53:090000.Dialogue: I got him, Leonard. Tonight I spice my mead with goblin blood.

00:00:58:090000.Scene: Sheldon and Leonard’s apartment. Sheldon, Leonard, Howard and Raj are using laptops. All are wearing microphone headsets.
00:00:58:090000.Speaker: Leonard
00:00:58:090000.Dialogue: Raj, no, it's a trap! They're flanking us!

00:01:00:120000.Scene: Sheldon and Leonard’s apartment. Sheldon, Leonard, Howard and Raj are using laptops. All are wearing microphone headsets.
00:01:00:120000.Speaker: Raj

00:01:02:130000.Scene: Sheldon and Leonard’s apartment. Sheldon, Leonard, Howard and Raj are using laptops. All are wearing microphone headsets.
00:01:02:130000.Speaker: Howard
00:01:02:130000.Dialogue: Sheldon, he's got Raj. Use your sleep spell!

00:01:06:220000.Scene: Sheldon and Leonard’s apartment. Sheldon, Leonard, Howard and Raj are using laptops. All are wearing microphone headsets.
00:01:06:220000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:01:06:220000.Dialogue: I've got the Sword of Asaroth!

00:01:10:230000.Scene: Sheldon and Leonard’s apartment. Sheldon, Leonard, Howard and Raj are using laptops. All are wearing microphone headsets.
00:01:10:230000.Speaker: Leonard

00:01:12:180000.Scene: Sheldon and Leonard’s apartment. Sheldon, Leonard, Howard and Raj are using laptops. All are wearing microphone headsets.
00:01:12:180000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:01:12:180000.Dialogue: There is no more Sheldon. I am the sword master!

00:01:16:140000.Scene: Sheldon and Leonard’s apartment. Sheldon, Leonard, Howard and Raj are using laptops. All are wearing microphone headsets.
00:01:16:140000.Speaker: Howard
00:01:16:140000.Dialogue: - Leonard, look out! - Damn it, man, we're dying here!

00:01:19:050000.Scene: Sheldon and Leonard’s apartment. Sheldon, Leonard, Howard and Raj are using laptops. All are wearing microphone headsets.
00:01:19:050000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:01:21:180000.Scene: Sheldon and Leonard’s apartment. Sheldon, Leonard, Howard and Raj are using laptops. All are wearing microphone headsets.
00:01:21:180000.Speaker: Leonard

00:01:25:030000.Scene: Sheldon and Leonard’s apartment. Sheldon, Leonard, Howard and Raj are using laptops. All are wearing microphone headsets.
00:01:25:030000.Speaker: Raj
00:01:25:030000.Dialogue: He's selling the Sword of Asaroth on eBay.

00:01:28:230000.Scene: Sheldon and Leonard’s apartment. Sheldon, Leonard, Howard and Raj are using laptops. All are wearing microphone headsets.
00:01:28:230000.Speaker: Leonard
00:01:28:230000.Dialogue: You betrayed us for money? Who are you?

00:01:31:150000.Scene: Sheldon and Leonard’s apartment. Sheldon, Leonard, Howard and Raj are using laptops. All are wearing microphone headsets.
00:01:31:150000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:01:31:150000.Dialogue: I'm a rogue night elf. Don't you people read character descriptions?

00:01:35:140000.Scene: Sheldon and Leonard’s apartment. Sheldon, Leonard, Howard and Raj are using laptops. All are wearing microphone headsets.
00:01:35:140000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:01:35:140000.Dialogue: Wait, wait! Somebody just clicked Buy it now.

00:01:38:040000.Scene: Sheldon and Leonard’s apartment. Sheldon, Leonard, Howard and Raj are using laptops. All are wearing microphone headsets.
00:01:38:040000.Speaker: Howard

00:02:06:150000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:02:06:150000.Dialogue: Anybody want to log on to Second Life and go swimming? I just built a virtual pool.

00:02:11:120000.Speaker: Leonard
00:02:11:120000.Dialogue: No. I can't look at you or your avatar right now.

00:02:23:190000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:02:23:190000.Dialogue: Don't forget the mail you took accidentally on purpose as an excuse to talk to her.

00:02:30:030000.Speaker: Howard
00:02:30:030000.Dialogue: Stealing snail mail-- very old school. I like it.

00:02:34:100000.Speaker: Leonard
00:02:34:100000.Dialogue: Penny, the mailman, did it again...

00:02:38:190000.Speaker: Penny
00:02:38:190000.Dialogue: Hi, Leonard. This is Doug. Doug, this is my neighbor Leonard.

00:02:52:100000.Speaker: Leonard
00:02:52:100000.Dialogue: Yeah, no, I just... I got your mail again. Here.

00:02:55:040000.Speaker: Penny
00:02:55:040000.Dialogue: Thank you. I've got to talk to that mailman.

00:02:57:070000.Speaker: Leonard
00:02:57:070000.Dialogue: Oh, no, that's probably not such a good idea.

00:03:00:150000.Speaker: Leonard
00:03:00:150000.Dialogue: Civil servants have a documented propensity to, you know, snap, so...

00:03:08:120000.Speaker: Leonard
00:03:08:120000.Dialogue: No problem. Bye. Oh, and bye... bro.

00:03:26:030000.Speaker: Leonard
00:03:26:030000.Dialogue: I'm fine. Penny's fine. The guy she's kissing is really fine.

00:03:31:180000.Speaker: Howard
00:03:31:180000.Dialogue: Kissing, what kind of kissing? Cheeks? Lips? Chaste? French?

00:03:43:150000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:03:43:150000.Dialogue: Don't tell me that your hopeless infatuation is devolving into pointless jealousy.

00:03:47:160000.Speaker: Leonard
00:03:47:160000.Dialogue: I'm not jealous. I'm just a little concerned for her. I didn't like the look of the guy.

00:03:52:180000.Speaker: Howard
00:03:52:180000.Dialogue: Because he looks better than you?

00:04:00:150000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:04:00:150000.Dialogue: At least now you can retrieve the black box from the twisted, smoldering wreckage that was once your fantasy of dating her and analyze the data so that you don't crash into Geek Mountain again.

00:04:11:170000.Speaker: Howard
00:04:11:170000.Dialogue: I disagree. Love is not a sprint, it's a marathon-- a relentless pursuit that only ends when she falls into your arms... or hits you with the pepper spray.

00:04:24:160000.Speaker: Leonard
00:04:24:160000.Dialogue: I'm done with Penny. I'm going to be more realistic and go after someone my own speed.

00:04:33:020000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:04:33:020000.Dialogue: The dietician at the cafeteria with the limp and the lazy eye?

00:04:39:050000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:04:39:050000.Dialogue: I don't think you have a shot there.

00:04:42:130000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:04:42:130000.Dialogue: I have noticed that Leslie Winkle recently started shaving her legs. Now given that winter is coming, one can only assume she's signaling sexual availability.

00:04:51:030000.Speaker: Howard
00:04:51:030000.Dialogue: I don't know. You guys work in the same lab.

00:05:05:090000.Speaker: Leonard
00:05:05:090000.Dialogue: If I were to ask Leslie Winkle out, it would just be for dinner. I'm not going to walk into the lab, ask her to strip naked and dance for me.

00:05:20:200000.Speaker: Leonard
00:05:20:200000.Dialogue: I'd like to propose an experiment...

00:05:26:110000.Speaker: Leonard
00:05:26:110000.Dialogue: I would like to propose an experiment.

00:05:28:080000.Speaker: Lesley
00:05:28:080000.Dialogue: Hang on. I'm trying to see how long it takes a 500-kilowatt oxygen iodine laser to heat up my Cup a' Noodles.

00:05:36:110000.Speaker: Leonard
00:05:36:110000.Dialogue: I've done it. About two seconds. 2.6 for minestrone.

00:05:45:230000.Speaker: Leonard
00:05:45:230000.Dialogue: Anyway, I was thinking more of a bio-social exploration with a neuro-chemical overlay.

00:05:52:230000.Speaker: Lesley
00:05:52:230000.Dialogue: Wait, are you asking me out?

00:05:56:050000.Speaker: Leonard
00:05:56:050000.Dialogue: I was going to characterize it as the modification of our colleague-slash-friendship paradigm with the addition of a date-like component, but we don't need to quibble over terminology.

00:06:07:100000.Speaker: Lesley
00:06:07:100000.Dialogue: What sort of experiment? There's a generally accepted pattern in this area.

00:06:11:190000.Speaker: Leonard
00:06:11:190000.Dialogue: I would pick you up, take you to a restaurant. Then we would see a movie, probably a romantic comedy featuring the talents of Hugh Grant or Sandra Bullock.

00:06:20:190000.Speaker: Lesley
00:06:20:190000.Dialogue: Interesting. And would you agree that the primary way we would evaluate either the success or failure of the date would be based on the biochemical reaction during the good night kiss?

00:06:32:120000.Speaker: Lesley
00:06:32:120000.Dialogue: Why don't we just stipulate that the date goes well and move to the key variable?

00:06:38:100000.Speaker: Leonard
00:06:38:100000.Dialogue: Can you define the parameters of the kiss?

00:06:51:230000.Speaker: Lesley
00:06:51:230000.Dialogue: No, I think it needs to be spontaneous.

00:07:01:190000.Speaker: Leonard
00:07:01:190000.Dialogue: - You proposed the experiment. I think you should present your findings first.

00:07:06:150000.Speaker: Lesley
00:07:06:150000.Dialogue: Fair enough. On the plus side, it was a good kiss. Reasonable technique, no extraneous spittle.

00:07:14:190000.Speaker: Lesley
00:07:14:190000.Dialogue: On the other hand, no arousal.

00:07:36:230000.Scene: Sheldon and Leonard’s flat. Sheldon, Raj and Howard are playing Jenga.
00:07:36:230000.Speaker: Howard
00:07:36:230000.Dialogue: Sheldon, if you were a robot, and I knew and you didn't...

00:07:44:140000.Scene: Sheldon and Leonard’s flat. Sheldon, Raj and Howard are playing Jenga.
00:07:44:140000.Speaker: Howard
00:07:44:140000.Dialogue: ...would you want me to tell you?

00:07:48:020000.Scene: Sheldon and Leonard’s flat. Sheldon, Raj and Howard are playing Jenga.
00:07:48:020000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:07:48:020000.Dialogue: That depends. When I learn that I'm a robot... will I be able to handle it?

00:07:56:140000.Scene: Sheldon and Leonard’s flat. Sheldon, Raj and Howard are playing Jenga.
00:07:56:140000.Speaker: Howard
00:07:56:140000.Dialogue: Maybe-- although the history of science fiction is not on your side.

00:08:01:070000.Scene: Sheldon and Leonard’s flat. Sheldon, Raj and Howard are playing Jenga.
00:08:01:070000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:08:01:070000.Dialogue: Okay, let me ask you this-- when I learn that I'm a robot, would I be bound by Asimov's Three Laws of Robotics?

00:08:10:090000.Scene: Sheldon and Leonard’s flat. Sheldon, Raj and Howard are playing Jenga.
00:08:10:090000.Speaker: Raj
00:08:10:090000.Dialogue: You might be bound by them right now.

00:08:16:200000.Scene: Sheldon and Leonard’s flat. Sheldon, Raj and Howard are playing Jenga.
00:08:16:200000.Speaker: Howard
00:08:16:200000.Dialogue: That's true. Have you ever harmed a human being or through inaction allowed a human being to come to harm?

00:08:21:130000.Scene: Sheldon and Leonard’s flat. Sheldon, Raj and Howard are playing Jenga.
00:08:21:130000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:08:27:200000.Scene: Sheldon and Leonard’s flat. Sheldon, Raj and Howard are playing Jenga.
00:08:27:200000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:08:33:190000.Scene: Sheldon and Leonard’s flat. Sheldon, Raj and Howard are playing Jenga.
00:08:33:190000.Speaker: Leonard

00:08:35:060000.Scene: Sheldon and Leonard’s flat. Sheldon, Raj and Howard are playing Jenga.
00:08:35:060000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:08:35:060000.Dialogue: Internet's been down for half an hour.

00:08:40:020000.Scene: Sheldon and Leonard’s flat. Sheldon, Raj and Howard are playing Jenga.
00:08:40:020000.Speaker: Raj
00:08:40:020000.Dialogue: Also, Sheldon may be a robot.

00:08:43:220000.Scene: Sheldon and Leonard’s flat. Sheldon, Raj and Howard are playing Jenga.
00:08:43:220000.Speaker: Howard
00:08:43:220000.Dialogue: So how'd it go with Leslie?

00:08:46:210000.Scene: Sheldon and Leonard’s flat. Sheldon, Raj and Howard are playing Jenga.
00:08:46:210000.Speaker: Leonard
00:08:46:210000.Dialogue: Oh, we tried kissing, but the Earth didn't move. I mean, any more than the 383 miles that it was going to move anyway.

00:08:57:090000.Scene: Sheldon and Leonard’s flat. Sheldon, Raj and Howard are playing Jenga.
00:08:57:090000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:08:57:090000.Dialogue: Oh, I've seen that look before. This is just going to be two weeks of moping and tedious emo songs and calling me to come down to pet stores to look at cats.

00:09:08:140000.Scene: Sheldon and Leonard’s flat. Sheldon, Raj and Howard are playing Jenga.
00:09:08:140000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:09:08:140000.Dialogue: I don't know if I can take it.

00:09:11:030000.Scene: Sheldon and Leonard’s flat. Sheldon, Raj and Howard are playing Jenga.
00:09:11:030000.Speaker: Raj

00:09:15:160000.Scene: Sheldon and Leonard’s flat. Sheldon, Raj and Howard are playing Jenga.
00:09:15:160000.Speaker: Howard
00:09:15:160000.Dialogue: As usual, Wolowitz has the solution. I happen to know a place where there are plenty of eligible women and Leonard could have his pick.

00:09:34:210000.Scene: A salsa class. The four guys and a random fat bloke salsa opposite five middle-aged women.
00:09:34:210000.Speaker: Class instructor
00:09:34:210000.Dialogue: Remember the Latin hips. Shoulders stay still, and... we sway.

00:09:45:050000.Scene: A salsa class. The four guys and a random fat bloke salsa opposite five middle-aged women.
00:09:45:050000.Speaker: Class instructor

00:09:50:210000.Scene: A salsa class. The four guys and a random fat bloke salsa opposite five middle-aged women.
00:09:50:210000.Speaker: Howard
00:09:50:210000.Dialogue: I think Mrs. Tishman's got her eye on you.

00:09:54:080000.Scene: A salsa class. The four guys and a random fat bloke salsa opposite five middle-aged women.
00:09:54:080000.Speaker: Howard
00:09:54:080000.Dialogue: I've been there. You're in for a treat.

00:10:11:210000.Scene: The flat, Leonard is entering, singing to himself a depressing emo song.
00:10:11:210000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:10:23:160000.Scene: The flat, Leonard is entering, singing to himself a depressing emo song.
00:10:23:160000.Speaker: Leonard

00:10:26:090000.Scene: The flat, Leonard is entering, singing to himself a depressing emo song.
00:10:26:090000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:10:26:090000.Dialogue: If you're compiling a mix CD for a double suicide.

00:10:30:040000.Scene: The flat, Leonard is entering, singing to himself a depressing emo song.
00:10:30:040000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:10:30:040000.Dialogue: Oh, I hope that scratching post is for you.

00:10:34:030000.Scene: The flat, Leonard is entering, singing to himself a depressing emo song.
00:10:34:030000.Speaker: Leonard
00:10:34:030000.Dialogue: I know what you're thinking. I've taken your asthma into account. There's a feline geneticist in San Diego who's developed the cutest little hypoallergenic calicos.

00:10:42:060000.Scene: The flat, Leonard is entering, singing to himself a depressing emo song.
00:10:42:060000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:10:49:130000.Scene: The flat, Leonard is entering, singing to himself a depressing emo song.
00:10:49:130000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:10:49:130000.Dialogue: Do you really think you can satisfy your need for a relationship with a genetically altered cat?

00:10:54:200000.Scene: The flat, Leonard is entering, singing to himself a depressing emo song.
00:10:54:200000.Speaker: Leonard
00:10:54:200000.Dialogue: Maybe. If it's a cute, little, cuddly cat.

00:10:58:200000.Scene: The flat, Leonard is entering, singing to himself a depressing emo song.
00:10:58:200000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:10:58:200000.Dialogue: Oh, come on. Leonard... This is obviously about Penny.

00:11:07:050000.Scene: The flat, Leonard is entering, singing to himself a depressing emo song.
00:11:07:050000.Speaker: Leonard
00:11:07:050000.Dialogue: It doesn't matter. The woman's not interested in me. The woman rejected me.

00:11:12:200000.Scene: The flat, Leonard is entering, singing to himself a depressing emo song.
00:11:12:200000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:11:12:200000.Dialogue: Look, I think that you have as much of a chance of having a sexual relationship with Penny as the Hubble Telescope does of discovering at the center of every black hole is a little man with a flashlight searching for a circuit breaker.

00:11:28:050000.Scene: The flat, Leonard is entering, singing to himself a depressing emo song.
00:11:28:050000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:11:28:050000.Dialogue: Nevertheless, I do feel obligated to point out to you that she did not reject you. You did not ask her out.

00:11:39:020000.Scene: The flat, Leonard is entering, singing to himself a depressing emo song.
00:11:39:020000.Speaker: Leonard
00:11:39:020000.Dialogue: You're right. I didn't ask her out. I should ask her out.

00:11:42:220000.Scene: The flat, Leonard is entering, singing to himself a depressing emo song.
00:11:42:220000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:11:42:220000.Dialogue: No, no, that was not my point. My point was don't buy a cat.

00:11:48:160000.Scene: The flat, Leonard is entering, singing to himself a depressing emo song.
00:11:48:160000.Speaker: Leonard
00:11:48:160000.Dialogue: No, but you're right. I should march over there and ask her out.

00:11:53:140000.Scene: The flat, Leonard is entering, singing to himself a depressing emo song.
00:11:53:140000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:11:53:140000.Dialogue: Oh, goody, we're getting a cat.

00:12:04:130000.Scene: The hallway. Leonard knocks on Penny’s door.
00:12:04:130000.Speaker: Leonard
00:12:04:130000.Dialogue: Good afternoon, Penny. So, hi... hey. I was wondering if you had plans for dinner.

00:12:11:120000.Scene: The hallway. Leonard knocks on Penny’s door.
00:12:11:120000.Speaker: Penny

00:12:14:040000.Scene: The hallway. Leonard knocks on Penny’s door.
00:12:14:040000.Speaker: Leonard
00:12:14:040000.Dialogue: There is an inherent ambiguity in the word dinner. Technically it refers to the largest meal of the day whenever it's consumed. So to clarify here, by dinner I mean supper.

00:12:23:040000.Scene: The hallway. Leonard knocks on Penny’s door.
00:12:23:040000.Speaker: Penny

00:12:26:030000.Scene: The hallway. Leonard knocks on Penny’s door.
00:12:26:030000.Speaker: Leonard
00:12:26:030000.Dialogue: I was thinking 6:30 if you can go. Or a different time.

00:12:28:200000.Scene: The hallway. Leonard knocks on Penny’s door.
00:12:28:200000.Speaker: Penny

00:12:30:060000.Scene: The hallway. Leonard knocks on Penny’s door.
00:12:30:060000.Speaker: Leonard

00:12:33:130000.Scene: The hallway. Leonard knocks on Penny’s door.
00:12:33:130000.Speaker: Leonard

00:12:36:010000.Scene: The hallway. Leonard knocks on Penny’s door.
00:12:36:010000.Speaker: Leonard

00:12:37:090000.Scene: The hallway. Leonard knocks on Penny’s door.
00:12:37:090000.Speaker: Penny
00:12:37:090000.Dialogue: Yeah, you know, Sheldon, Howard, Raj. Who all's coming?

00:12:41:020000.Scene: The hallway. Leonard knocks on Penny’s door.
00:12:41:020000.Speaker: Leonard

00:12:47:000000.Scene: The hallway. Leonard knocks on Penny’s door.
00:12:47:000000.Speaker: Leonard
00:12:47:000000.Dialogue: Or a subset of them might be there. Algebraically speaking, there are too many unknowns. For example, Sheldon had Quiznos for lunch. Sometimes he finds that filling, other times he doesn't. It's no fault of Quiznos-- they have a varied menu.

00:13:01:170000.Scene: The hallway. Leonard knocks on Penny’s door.
00:13:01:170000.Speaker: Penny
00:13:01:170000.Dialogue: Okay, whatever. It sounds like fun.

00:13:04:040000.Scene: The hallway. Leonard knocks on Penny’s door.
00:13:04:040000.Speaker: Leonard
00:13:04:040000.Dialogue: Great. - Did we say a time?

00:13:05:190000.Scene: The hallway. Leonard knocks on Penny’s door.
00:13:05:190000.Speaker: Penny

00:13:07:100000.Scene: The hallway. Leonard knocks on Penny’s door.
00:13:07:100000.Speaker: Leonard

00:13:09:050000.Scene: The hallway. Leonard knocks on Penny’s door.
00:13:09:050000.Speaker: Penny

00:13:11:230000.Scene: The hallway. Leonard knocks on Penny’s door.
00:13:11:230000.Speaker: Leonard

00:13:15:030000.Scene: The hallway. Leonard knocks on Penny’s door.
00:13:15:030000.Speaker: Penny

00:13:18:140000.Scene: The hallway. Leonard knocks on Penny’s door.
00:13:18:140000.Speaker: Leonard
00:13:18:140000.Dialogue: To... carve the... I'll see you at 6:30.

00:13:21:000000.Scene: The hallway. Leonard knocks on Penny’s door.

00:13:33:100000.Scene: The hallway. Leonard knocks on Penny’s door.
00:13:33:100000.Speaker: Leonard

00:13:39:180000.Scene: The hallway. Leonard knocks on Penny’s door.
00:13:39:180000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:13:43:060000.Scene: The hallway. Leonard knocks on Penny’s door.
00:13:43:060000.Speaker: Leonard
00:13:43:060000.Dialogue: Can you tell I'm perspiring a little?

00:13:46:120000.Scene: The hallway. Leonard knocks on Penny’s door.
00:13:46:120000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:13:46:120000.Dialogue: No. The dark crescent-shaped patterns under your arms conceal it nicely.

00:13:53:030000.Scene: The hallway. Leonard knocks on Penny’s door.
00:13:53:030000.Speaker: Leonard

00:13:55:040000.Scene: The hallway. Leonard knocks on Penny’s door.
00:13:55:040000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:13:55:040000.Dialogue: Perfect. That gives you two hours and 15 minutes for that dense molecular cloud of Aramis to dissipate.

00:14:01:230000.Scene: The hallway. Leonard knocks on Penny’s door.
00:14:01:230000.Speaker: Leonard

00:14:03:040000.Scene: The hallway. Leonard knocks on Penny’s door.
00:14:03:040000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:14:03:040000.Dialogue: Not if you're a rugby team.

00:14:06:210000.Scene: The hallway. Leonard knocks on Penny’s door.
00:14:06:210000.Speaker: Leonard
00:14:06:210000.Dialogue: If it should ever come up, you didn't join us because you stuffed yourself with a chicken carbonara sub at Quiznos.

00:14:12:140000.Scene: The hallway. Leonard knocks on Penny’s door.
00:14:12:140000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:14:14:200000.Scene: The hallway. Leonard knocks on Penny’s door.
00:14:14:200000.Speaker: Leonard

00:14:18:200000.Scene: The hallway. Leonard knocks on Penny’s door.
00:14:18:200000.Speaker: Leonard
00:14:18:200000.Dialogue: You know what, maybe this isn't such a good idea.

00:14:21:090000.Scene: The hallway. Leonard knocks on Penny’s door.
00:14:21:090000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:14:21:090000.Dialogue: No, well, now there's always the possibility that alcohol and poor judgment on her part might lead to a nice romantic evening.

00:14:30:070000.Scene: The hallway. Leonard knocks on Penny’s door.
00:14:30:070000.Speaker: Leonard
00:14:30:070000.Dialogue: You're right. Alcohol, poor judgment-- it could go well.

00:14:33:200000.Scene: The hallway. Leonard knocks on Penny’s door.
00:14:33:200000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:14:33:200000.Dialogue: There is the other possibility, that... this date kicks off a rather unpleasant 6 months of the two of you passing awkwardly in the hall, until one of you breaks down and moves to another zip code.

00:14:44:010000.Scene: The hallway. Leonard knocks on Penny’s door.
00:14:44:010000.Speaker: Leonard
00:14:44:010000.Dialogue: You could've stopped at it could go well.

00:14:47:150000.Scene: The hallway. Leonard knocks on Penny’s door.
00:14:47:150000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:14:49:220000.Scene: The hallway. Leonard knocks on Penny’s door.
00:14:49:220000.Speaker: Leonard
00:14:49:220000.Dialogue: I mean, I'm a perfectly nice guy. There's no reason we couldn't go and have a lovely dinner, maybe take a walk afterwards, talk about things we have in common. You love pottery? I love pottery! There's a pause, we both know what's happening. I lean in, we kiss. It's a little tentative at first, but then I realize she's kissing me back. She's biting my lower lip! She wants me! This thing is going the distance! We're going to have sex! Oh, God, oh, my God!

00:15:18:190000.Scene: The hallway. Leonard knocks on Penny’s door.
00:15:18:190000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:15:22:010000.Scene: The hallway. Leonard knocks on Penny’s door.
00:15:22:010000.Speaker: Leonard

00:15:24:170000.Scene: The hallway. Leonard knocks on Penny’s door.
00:15:24:170000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:15:26:220000.Scene: The hallway. Leonard knocks on Penny’s door.
00:15:26:220000.Speaker: Leonard
00:15:26:220000.Dialogue: If I could, I wouldn't be having a panic... That's why they call it a panic attack.

00:15:31:160000.Scene: The hallway. Leonard knocks on Penny’s door.
00:15:31:160000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:15:31:160000.Dialogue: Sit down. Yeah, sit down. Now close your eyes.

00:15:35:150000.Scene: The hallway. Leonard knocks on Penny’s door.
00:15:35:150000.Speaker: Leonard

00:15:40:210000.Scene: The hallway. Leonard knocks on Penny’s door.
00:15:40:210000.Speaker: Leonard

00:15:53:190000.Scene: The hallway. Leonard knocks on Penny’s door.
00:15:53:190000.Speaker: Leonard
00:15:53:190000.Dialogue: Who am I kidding? I can't go through with this. You need to call her and cancel.

00:15:57:110000.Scene: The hallway. Leonard knocks on Penny’s door.
00:15:57:110000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:15:58:170000.Scene: The hallway. Leonard knocks on Penny’s door.
00:15:58:170000.Speaker: Leonard
00:15:58:170000.Dialogue: - I don't know. Tell her I'm sick. Not an illness that will make her want to take care of me, but nothing so critical that she'll feel uncomfortable going out with me if I want to try this again.

00:16:09:110000.Scene: The hallway. Leonard knocks on Penny’s door.
00:16:09:110000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:16:09:110000.Dialogue: Got it. So I'm assuming nothing venereal?

00:16:16:180000.Scene: The hallway. Leonard knocks on Penny’s door.
00:16:16:180000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:16:16:180000.Dialogue: I'll just tell her that you had a routine colonoscopy and haven't quite bounced back.

00:16:21:140000.Scene: The hallway. Leonard knocks on Penny’s door.
00:16:21:140000.Speaker: Leonard

00:16:23:230000.Scene: The hallway. Leonard knocks on Penny’s door.
00:16:23:230000.Speaker: Leonard
00:16:23:230000.Dialogue: I can't, because if I don't show up she'll still be expecting you.

00:16:27:120000.Scene: The hallway. Leonard knocks on Penny’s door.
00:16:27:120000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:16:27:120000.Dialogue: Why would she be expecting me?

00:16:30:100000.Scene: The hallway. Leonard knocks on Penny’s door.
00:16:30:100000.Speaker: Leonard
00:16:30:100000.Dialogue: Stop asking me all these questions. I need to take another shower.

00:16:37:130000.Speaker: Penny
00:16:37:130000.Dialogue: So are the rest of the guys meeting us here?

00:16:42:100000.Speaker: Leonard
00:16:42:100000.Dialogue: It turns out that Raj and Howard had to work, and Sheldon... had a colonoscopy and he hasn't quite bounced back yet.

00:16:51:120000.Speaker: Penny
00:16:51:120000.Dialogue: My uncle just had a colonoscopy.

00:16:53:130000.Speaker: Leonard
00:16:53:130000.Dialogue: You're kidding. Then that's something we have in common.

00:16:59:230000.Speaker: Leonard
00:16:59:230000.Dialogue: We both have people in our lives who... want to nip intestinal polyps in the bud.

00:17:12:070000.Speaker: Penny
00:17:12:070000.Dialogue: So what's new in the world of physics?

00:17:19:150000.Speaker: Leonard
00:17:19:150000.Dialogue: Well, with the exception of string theory, not much has happened since the 1930s. And you can't prove string theory. At best you can say, Hey, look, my idea has an internal logical consistency.

00:17:35:050000.Speaker: Penny
00:17:35:050000.Dialogue: Well, I'm sure things will pick up.

00:17:41:140000.Speaker: Leonard
00:17:41:140000.Dialogue: What's new at the Cheesecake Factory?

00:17:45:010000.Speaker: Penny
00:17:45:010000.Dialogue: Not much. We do have a chocolate key lime that's moving pretty well.

00:18:01:160000.Speaker: Penny
00:18:01:160000.Dialogue: Doug? Oh, yeah, I don't know. I mean, you know, he's nice and funny, but...

00:18:06:120000.Speaker: Waitress
00:18:06:120000.Dialogue: Can I get you started with some drinks?

00:18:11:230000.Speaker: Leonard
00:18:11:230000.Dialogue: Just say the but thing about Doug and then I'll get her back.

00:18:17:080000.Speaker: Penny
00:18:17:080000.Dialogue: I don't know, it's just me. I'm still getting over this breakup with Kurt and this thing with Doug would just be rebound sex.

00:18:25:110000.Speaker: Leonard
00:18:25:110000.Dialogue: Don't get me started on rebound sex.

00:18:29:070000.Speaker: Penny
00:18:29:070000.Dialogue: It's just... it's my pattern. I break up, then I find some cute guy, and then it's just 36 meaningless hours of... you know.

00:18:40:100000.Speaker: Leonard
00:18:40:100000.Dialogue: I'm not sure that I do.

00:18:43:100000.Speaker: Leonard
00:18:43:100000.Dialogue: Is that one 36-hour experience, or is that 36 hours spread out over, say... one glorious summer?

00:18:51:200000.Speaker: Penny
00:18:51:200000.Dialogue: No, it's usually over a weekend, and trust me, you do not feel good after it.

00:19:11:040000.Speaker: Leonard
00:19:11:040000.Dialogue: Do you want to see something cool? I can make this olive go into this glass without touching it.

00:19:29:130000.Speaker: Leonard
00:19:29:130000.Dialogue: Actually, it's centripetal force, which is an inward force generated by the glass acting on the olive... Excuse me. If you were riding on the olive, you'd be in a non-inertial reference frame and would...

00:19:56:210000.Scene: The stairwell of the apartment building.
00:19:56:210000.Speaker: Penny
00:19:56:210000.Dialogue: You sure you don't want to go to the emergency room?

00:19:59:020000.Scene: The stairwell of the apartment building.
00:19:59:020000.Speaker: Leonard
00:19:59:020000.Dialogue: No, I'm okay. It stopped bleeding.

00:20:01:190000.Scene: The stairwell of the apartment building.
00:20:01:190000.Speaker: Penny
00:20:01:190000.Dialogue: I know, but you did throw up. Isn't that a sign of a concussion?

00:20:04:230000.Scene: The stairwell of the apartment building.
00:20:04:230000.Speaker: Leonard
00:20:04:230000.Dialogue: Yes. But I get car sick, too, so...

00:20:09:150000.Scene: The stairwell of the apartment building.
00:20:09:150000.Speaker: Leonard
00:20:09:150000.Dialogue: Sorry about your car, by the way.

00:20:12:030000.Scene: The stairwell of the apartment building.
00:20:12:030000.Speaker: Penny
00:20:12:030000.Dialogue: It's fine. You got most of it out the window.

00:20:15:210000.Scene: The stairwell of the apartment building.
00:20:15:210000.Speaker: Leonard
00:20:15:210000.Dialogue: The poor guy on the bike.

00:20:20:080000.Scene: The stairwell of the apartment building.
00:20:20:080000.Speaker: Leonard

00:20:21:210000.Scene: The stairwell of the apartment building.
00:20:21:210000.Speaker: Penny
00:20:21:210000.Dialogue: Yeah, me, too. Well, um, good night. Good night. Was this supposed to be a date?

00:20:34:070000.Scene: The stairwell of the apartment building.
00:20:34:070000.Speaker: Leonard

00:20:40:050000.Scene: The stairwell of the apartment building.
00:20:40:050000.Speaker: Leonard
00:20:40:050000.Dialogue: Of course not. This was just you and me hanging out with a bunch of guys who didn't show up 'cause of work and a colonoscopy.

00:20:48:200000.Scene: The stairwell of the apartment building.
00:20:48:200000.Speaker: Penny

00:20:51:140000.Scene: The stairwell of the apartment building.
00:20:51:140000.Speaker: Leonard
00:20:51:140000.Dialogue: When I take a girl on a date-- and I do--

00:20:57:020000.Scene: The stairwell of the apartment building.
00:20:57:020000.Speaker: Leonard
00:20:57:020000.Dialogue: she knows she's been dated. Capital D. Boldface. Underlined. Da...ted.

00:21:08:190000.Speaker: Leonard
00:21:08:190000.Dialogue: I think I might have a little concussion. I'm gonna go lie down for a while. Good night.
